newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish bond yields end sharply higher on U.S..
newsitem.headline: Swedish bond yields end sharply higher on U.S..

text.p: Swedish bond yields ended sharply higher on Tuesday, hurt by a weaker U.S.-market.
The upturn was also a correction from a fall on Thursday, the last day of trading ahead of Easter holidays.
The crown softened on higher yields and a correction from its Thursday strength.

The Riksbank left its key interest rate, the repo, unchanged at 4.10 percent, which was expected. * Six-month T-bill rate climbs ten basis points to 4.25 pct. * Ten-year bond yield rises nineteen basis points to 7.46 pct. * Crown softens to 4.5420 to mark vs 4.5040 Thursday.
STOCKHOLM, April 1 (Reuter) - Swedish bond yields ended sharply higher on Tuesday, hurt by a weaker U.S.-market, and the crown softened.
The upturn in yields was also a correction from a fall on Thursday, the last day of trading ahead of Easter holidays, dealers said.
"The downward movement was largely uncalled for and now the market is adjusting upwards in quiet trade," one dealer said.
He added that the trend is changing and that yields are bound to rise in the long run.
The weaker bond market hurt the crown, as did a correction.
The crown softened to 4.5420 crowns against the mark from 4.5040 crowns on Thursday.
The currency could also have been hurt by bourse portfolio changes. "It is also possible some have sold Swedish shares and invested abroad," one dealer said.
The six-month T-bill rate jumped 10 basis points to 4.25 percent, while the ten-year bond yield leaped 19 basis points to 7.46 percent.
The Riksbank left its key interest rate, the repo rate, unchanged at 4.10 percent, which was expected.
